description_txt: stated on November 1, 2010 in an interview:
quote_txt: "Democrats have now become the party of the [Atlanta] metro area and of blacks."

description_txt: stated on February 28, 2011 in an op-ed column.:
quote_txt: Says taxes paid by the poorest residents of Texas are above the national average.

description_txt: stated on February 25, 2011 in State of the City address.:
quote_txt: Says four-year terms for City Council members are "the norm in most cities of our size."

description_txt: stated on March 2, 2011 in a radio interview:
quote_txt: At Twin River, "we're more than competitive" with nearby casinos in slot machine payouts.
footer: By C. Eugene Emery Jr. • March 13, 2011

description_txt: stated on March 4, 2011 in a letter to President Barack Obama:
quote_txt: Tapping the Strategic Petroleum Reserve would immediately lower gasoline prices

description_txt: stated on February 26, 2011 in an oped column.:
quote_txt: Texans eat more catfish than residents of all other states combined.

description_txt: stated on March 10, 2011 in a radio interview:
quote_txt: On the night of the Wisconsin state Senate vote on the budget package, "a mob showed up and busted down the door and took over the Capitol."

description_txt: stated on February 11, 2011 in a newsletter.:
quote_txt: "A new ruling by the EPA would force dairy farmers to comply with the Spill Prevention, Control and Countermeasure Program when dealing with spilt milk -- the same regulations oil and natural gas producers must follow."

description_txt: stated on February 25, 2011 in a Texas Tribune article.:
quote_txt: Says Texas school districts are the fifth largest employers in the world.

description_txt: stated on March 1, 2011 in a flier and campaign website:
quote_txt: Says Charlotte Nash "pretends to be a chicken farmer" in order to get property tax exemptions.

description_txt: stated on March 10, 2011 in comments while discussing merit pay for teachers:
quote_txt: Says students who receive free or reduced lunch are "performing just as well" as students who do not.

description_txt: stated on March 10, 2011 in a campaign TV ad:
quote_txt: Tampa mayoral opponent Bob Buckhorn "supported forcing police officers to keep their guns locked in the trunks of their cruisers."

description_txt: stated on February 21, 2011 in an interview on Fox News:
quote_txt: "Our average private sector employee pays 23 percent for their health care. Our average city worker in Ohio pays 9 percent."

description_txt: stated on March 5, 2011 in a speech to protesters in Madison, Wisconsin:
quote_txt: "Just 400 Americans -- 400 -- have more wealth than half of all Americans combined."

description_txt: stated on March 4, 2011 in a post on his PAC's website:
quote_txt: Says it’s a "statistical reality that most single moms are very poor, under-educated, can't get a job, and if it weren't for government assistance, their kids would be starving to death."

description_txt: stated on March 7, 2011 in a speech to the Iowa Faith and Freedom Coalition.:
quote_txt: "Any child born prematurely, according to the president, in his own words, can be killed."

description_txt: stated on February 28, 2011 in a press release touting a state tourism program:
quote_txt: "We know that every 85 visitors create one Florida job."

description_txt: stated on March 2, 2011 in remarks on the House floor:
quote_txt: Says women who need a sonogram in the eighth to 10th week of pregnancy have to get a transvaginal sonogram.

description_txt: stated on March 9, 2011 in an online petition:
quote_txt: "Roughly 25% of RI has a criminal record"

description_txt: stated on March 8, 2011 in a statement responding to Gov. Rick Scott's State of the State speech.:
quote_txt: Says Rick Scott's proposed budget "would lay off 20,000 teachers."

description_txt: stated on March 6, 2011 in an interview on ABC's "This Week with Christiane Amanpour":
quote_txt: Says iPads and iPhones "are built in the United States of America."

description_txt: stated on February 1, 2011 in a news release:
quote_txt: Says Sen. Sherrod Brown admitted "that his $787 billion stimulus law failed" and "after specifically attacking Republicans for wanting to lower Americans' taxes, (he) now claims that his stimulus bill 'didn't do enough' to lower taxes."

description_txt: stated on March 2, 2011 in a website:
quote_txt: "Since 1999, all Virginia Lottery profits have been used for public education in the Commonwealth for kindergarten through 12th grade."

description_txt: stated on March 6, 2011 in various blog postings critical of Wisconsin Gov. Scott Walker:
quote_txt: Wisconsin Gov. Scott Walker’s "budget okays disposing of unclaimed pound dogs to university research facilities."

description_txt: stated on March 4, 2011 in an op-ed in The Atlanta Journal-Constitution:
quote_txt: A bill before the Georgia General Assembly would make presidential candidates meet citizenship requirements that are not in the U.S. Constitution.

description_txt: stated on March 8, 2011 in his State of the State speech.:
quote_txt: "I have asked the Division of Emergency Management to report directly to me."

description_txt: stated on March 8, 2011 in comments on MSNBC.:
quote_txt: Says Florida Gov. Rick Scott’s cuts to education are the same as his proposed corporate income tax rate reduction.

description_txt: stated on March 8, 2011 in in his State of the State speech:
quote_txt: Bing Energy said it decided to move to Florida because of Gov. Rick Scott’s "plan to eliminate the corporate tax."

description_txt: stated on March 8, 2011 in his State of the State speech.:
quote_txt: "I delivered to you a budget that ... cuts taxes by $2 billion."
